00022 #if defined(REPLICATION_SUPPORT)
00023 const int dbModMapBlockBits = 12; // 10;
00024 const int dbModMapBlockSize = 1 << dbModMapBlockBits;
00025 #elif defined(NO_MMAP)
00026 const int dbModMapBlockBits = 12;
00027 const int dbModMapBlockSize = 1 << dbModMapBlockBits;
00028 #endif
00029

00036 struct ReplicationRequest { 
00037     enum {
00038         RR_CONNECT, 
00039         RR_RECOVERY, 
00040         RR_GET_STATUS, 
00041         RR_STATUS, 
00042         RR_UPDATE_PAGE,
00043         RR_RECOVER_PAGE,
00044         RR_NEW_ACTIVE_NODE, 
00045         RR_CHANGE_ACTIVE_NODE, 
00046         RR_CLOSE, 
00047         RR_READY,
00048         RR_COMMITTED
00049     };
00050     byte op;
00051     byte nodeId;
00052     byte status;
00053     int  size;
00054     struct { 
00055         int updateCount;
00056         size_t offs;
00057     } page;
00058 };
00059

00061     dbFile*   file;
00062     int       nodeId;
00063     int       nPages;
00064     int*      updateCounters;
00065 };

00072 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY dbFile { 
00073   protected:
00074 #ifdef _WIN32
00075     HANDLE fh;
00076     HANDLE mh;
00077 #else
00078 #ifdef USE_SYSV_SHARED_MEMORY
00079     dbSharedMemory shmem;
00080 #endif
00081     int    fd;
00082 #endif
00083     char_t*  sharedName;
00084     char*  mmapAddr;
00085     size_t mmapSize;
00086     int    flags;
00087 
00088   public:
00089     enum { 
00090         ok = 0
00091     };
00092     enum OpenFlags {
00093         read_only       = 0x001, // open file in read-only mode
00094         truncate        = 0x002, // truncate file when opened
00095         sequential      = 0x004, // optimize for sequenial access 
00096         no_buffering    = 0x008, // do not use OS file cache
00097         no_sync         = 0x010, // do not flush data to the disk
00098         shared          = 0x020, // shared access to the file
00099         write_through   = 0x040, // write through 
00100         delete_on_close = 0x080, // delete file on close
00101         ram_file        = 0x100, // diskless mode
00102         force_read      = 0x200  // force load of mapped data from the file
00103     };
00104     //
00105     // Create backup file
00106     //
00107     virtual int   create(char_t const* name, int flags = no_buffering);
00108     //
00109     // Open database file and create file mapping object 
00110     //
00111     virtual int    open(char_t const* fileName, char_t const* sharedName,
00112                         int flags, size_t initSize, bool replicationSupport);
00113     
00114     virtual void*  getAddr() const { return mmapAddr; }
00115     virtual size_t getSize() const { return mmapSize; } 
00116     virtual int    setSize(size_t size, char_t const* sharedName, bool initialize = true);
00117     virtual int    flush(bool physical = false);
00118     virtual int    close();
00119     virtual int    erase();
00120     virtual int    write(void const* ptr, size_t& writtenBytes, size_t size);
00121     virtual int    read(void* ptr, size_t& readBytes, size_t size);
00122     virtual bool   write(void const* ptr, size_t size);
00123 
00124     static char* errorText(int code, char* buf, size_t bufSize);
00125 
00126     int forceRead(char* data, size_t size);
00127 
00128 #if defined(NO_MMAP) || defined(REPLICATION_SUPPORT)
00129 
00130 #ifdef PROTECT_DATABASE
00131     void protect(size_t pos, size_t size);
00132     void unprotect(size_t pos, size_t size);
00133 #endif
00134 
00135     void markAsDirty(size_t pos, size_t size) { 
00136         if (!(flags & ram_file)) {
00137             size_t page = pos >> dbModMapBlockBits;
00138             size_t last = (pos + size + dbModMapBlockSize - 1) >> dbModMapBlockBits;
00139             assert(int(last >> 5) <= pageMapSize);
00140             while (page < last) { 
00141                 pageMap[page >> 5] |= 1 << (page & 31);
00142                 page += 1;
00143             }
00144         }
00145     }
00146 
00147   private:
00148     int* pageMap;
00149     int  pageMapSize;
00150     int  pageSize;
00151 
00152 #ifdef FUZZY_CHECKPOINT
00153     dbFileWriter* writer;
00154   public:
00155     void setCheckpointBufferSize(size_t nPages);
00156 #endif
00157 
00158   public:
00159     int  updateCounter;
00160 
00161 #ifdef REPLICATION_SUPPORT
00162     int*      currUpdateCount;
00163     int*      diskUpdateCount;
00164     byte*     rootPage;
00165     bool      doSync;
00166     bool      closing;
00167 
00168     dbReplicatedDatabase* db;
00169 
00170     int       getUpdateCountTableSize();
00171     int       getMaxPages(); 
00172 
00173     dbMutex   replCS;
00174     dbMutex   syncCS;
00175 
00176     dbThread     syncThread;
00177     dbLocalEvent syncEvent;
00178     dbLocalEvent recoveredEvent;
00179     int          nRecovered;
00180 
00181     static int   dbSyncTimeout; // milliseconds
00182 
00183 #ifdef _WIN32
00184     HANDLE    cfh;
00185     HANDLE    cmh;
00186 #else
00187     int       cfd;
00188 #endif

00190     static void thread_proc startSyncToDisk(void* arg);
00191     static void thread_proc startRecovery(void* arg);

00194     void doRecovery(int nodeId, int* updateCounters, int nPages);

00201     void stopSync();

00203   public:
00204     void configure(dbReplicatedDatabase* db) { 
00205         this->db = db;
00206     }
00207 
00208     bool updatePages(socket_t* s, size_t pos, int updateCount, int size);
00209     bool concurrentUpdatePages(socket_t* s, size_t pos, int updateCount, int size);
00210     void recovery(int nodeId, int* updateCounters, int nPages);
00211 #endif // REPLICATION_SUPPORT
